skillTree.localised_description: Caradryan normally fights at the head of the Phoenix Guard, as befits his rank, but sometimes conducts the battle from the back of Ashtari, oldest and wisest of the Phoenixes of the Flamespyre.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

enabled_if: Winds of magic power is 15 or greater

skillTree.localised_description: Asuryan's adherents believe they are part of the Creator's plan and will never be abandoned.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Caradryan stands atop the walls of the Shrine, his keen gaze scouring the lands of Ulthuan. Indeed, it is said that no event is so small as to evade Caradryan's gaze, and no sound small enough to escape his hearing.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Enemy Hero action success chance: -25%
	(enemy characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Some have accused Caradryan of harnessing the prophecies of Asuryan in order to influence the future. However the truth of the matter is that he simply notices things that others do not, and has no prattling tongue to distract him from matters of greater import.

effects.description: Influence cost: -10% for Intrigue at Court actions

Hero action cost: -15%
	(Heroes in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Over his long years of study and contemplation, Caradryan has become ever closer to the thoughts of Asuryan, until finally the hand of the Creator marked him as the Captain of the Phoenix Guard.
Caradryan leads the devoted guardians of Asuryan during times of peace and war. There is divine strength in his hand and the wisdom of Asuryan sits upon his noble brow.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +8 for Phoenix Guard units
	(all units in army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Phoenix Guard units
	(all units in army)

Passive ability: "Guardian" for Phoenix Guard units
	(all units in army)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: There is a natural bond between the Phoenix Guard and the Phoenixes of Ulthuan. This is a truly fearsome combination, the clear headed judgement of the Phoenix knight directing the Phoenixes attacks to where they can cause the most damage.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Magical Harmony" for Phoenix units
	(replaces: "Attuned to Magic")
	(all units in army)

Melee attack: +6 for Phoenix units
	(all units in army)

Melee defence: +6 for Phoenix units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Caradryan serves the purpose and the plan of the Lord of the Gods, taking orders from no wordly master and appearing on the battlefield only by the will of Asuryan.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Flames of Asuryan" (when on foot)
Passive ability: "Aura of the Frozen Heart" (when mounted on Ashtari only)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: The sword is the axis of the world and its power is absolute.
Panic and fear are things that happen to others.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dark Elves
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: There is nothing but utter belief. There is no reasoning with this one.
"Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!"
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
This one fights with a fervour to be both admired and despised.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
There is nothing but utter belief. There is no reasoning with this one.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Turning an untrained bunch of regular citizens into effective fighting units requires a special kind of talent, and oodles of patience.

skillTree.localised_description: Missile combat isn't always about attacking; knowing how to defend also pays dividends.

skillTree.localised_description: Years of experience in mounted combat has started to pay off; this one is always in command of both their force and its steeds.

skillTree.localised_description: Being present at the very forefront of the assault, on many occasions, prepares one for future engagements of a similar nature.

skillTree.localised_description: The firmament holds no fear for this one, such is their command of the many airborne beasts of battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing that it is the rare plan that survives contact with the enemy, yet being prepared for all eventualities, raises this one above mere planners.

Melee attack: +4 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units

Melee defence: +6 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Like a wall of the hardest stone imaginable - such is their ability to withstand attack.

skillTree.localised_description: When the gale always blows in the direction of your choosing, failure becomes a rare event indeed.

skillTree.localised_description: Speed, agility and control - all must be mastered if your crushing tide is to break perfectly upon enemy shores.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The very centre of the fire always burns the hottest.

	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Dragon, Phoenixes, Dragon Princes and Phoenix Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Dragon, Phoenixes, Dragon Princes and Phoenix Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"Let your name be on the lips of every man and woman; your great deeds go before you!"
Sickness must be purged, and purge it shall be!

effects.description:
Construction cost: -5% for Worship buildings
	(all provinces)

Construction cost: -10% for Worship buildings
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Far removed from the petty squabbles of other races, many High Elves are able to devote themselves to learning, magic and the arts.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +8%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +16%
Magic item drop chance from battle: +24%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

items.colour_text: This ancient flame-wreathed weapon was enchanted for Kor-Baelon, the first Captain of the Phoenix Guard.
On Caradryan's forehead is the glowing rune of Asuryan, marking him as the servant of the Creator God. If the servant of Asuryan is killed in battle, there will be consequences.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Caradryan is the present day Captain of the Phoenix Guard, and wielder of the Phoenix Blade.

effects.description:
Enables "Numbing Coldness" attacks for Frostheart Phoenix
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +10 for Phoenix Guard and Phoenix units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -30% for Phoenix Guard and Phoenix units
	(Lord's army)
